sentence.Network_en: He found it distasteful to be offered drinks before witnessing the execution.
sentence.Network_cn: 他觉得在目睹行刑前还要上酒让人很不舒服。

sentence.Network_en: I found it a touch distasteful.
sentence.Network_cn: 我觉得这略有点让人反感。

sentence.Network_en: The very idea of cheating him is distasteful to me.
sentence.Network_cn: 欺骗他的那个想法使我很不愉快.

郑景婷考研英语高频词汇 - 豆丁网 ... distant 遥远的 408. distaste for 无品味 409. distinction—distinctly 区别；明显地 410.

...形容词为distasteful，常用搭配为distasteful (to sb)distasteful behaviour 讨厌的行为Even the thought of her was distasteful to him. 他即.

entry.tran: 使人不愉快的;令人反感的;讨厌的
entry.def: If something is distasteful to you, you think it is unpleasant, disgusting, or immoral.

example.ex: He found it distasteful to be offered drinks before witnessing the execution.
example.tran: 他觉得在目睹行刑前还要上酒让人很不舒服。

means.word_mean: 1. not pleasing in odor or taste
2. highly offensive; arousing aversion or disgust;

sentences.sentence: "the idea of eating meat is repellent to me"

auth_sentence.content: Why shou'd you pluck the green distasteful fruit.
auth_sentence.res_content: Why shou'd you pluck the green distasteful fruit.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Why shou'd you pluck the green distasteful fruit.

auth_sentence.content: Her private life was, to millions, distasteful.
auth_sentence.res_content: Her private life was, to millions, distasteful.

auth_sentence.content: To learn more can be dismaying and distasteful.

sentences.en: I find his attitude highly distasteful.
sentences.cn: 我觉得他的态度很令人厌恶。

sentences.en: The way Charles tried to make up to the boss was distasteful to the workers.
sentences.cn: 工人们很看不惯查尔斯想巴结老板的那种样子。

sentences.en: The work was thoroughly distasteful to her.
The medicine is distasteful but good for you.
sentences.cn: 这药虽难吃,但对你身体有好处。
